intro: Lotononis acocksii, commonly known as the Acock's lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
